content: double_crochet plus one row of single_crochet down the centre- in worsted with a 5 mm hook hot tips if you re doing more than one row of the morse code make sure that you set yourself up row wise so they all fall on the right side i found *1 row of double_crochet morse code row 2 row of single_crochet* repeat worked so that you had the same width on either side of the morse code as well as each row of morse code had the popcorn stitches on the same side once again if it helps you make sure your row/morse code is all laying on the right side *draw it out* it s a lot easier to go back and forth with pen and paper than to do an entire row just to find out oops it s got you on the wrong side sad trombone noises if you are doing more than one morse code row of a repeating motif and you d like to stagger them divide the number of stitches in your motif in half add those stitches to either side of the row the resist scarf has 46 stitches in the motif so you will add 23 stitches to either side to stagger the row nb you will still have to do the initial 3 single_crochet and last 4 single_crochet in order to keep your counts correct also you will have one less repeat on that row you can mix it up to your liking though- if you d like your morse code all on the same side they should either all fall on even or odd row you can choose the stitches on the row to create other visual patterns- you can play around to create your own play around have fun get out some pencil crayons and paper and draw some stuff out so you have a better idea of what things will look like- or throw
